snippet: The Fourth of July brought out the first visitors to the Statue of Liberty since Hurricane Sandy shut down the most famous monument in New York Harbor.
abstract: Fourth of July brings out the first visitors to the Statue of Liberty since Hurricane Sandy shut down the most famous monument in New York Harbor; although statue was not harmed by the storm, electrical wiring and several structures on Liberty Island, including docks for ferries to carry visitors from Lower Manhattan and Liberty State Park in Jersey City, were destroyed.
lead_paragraph: The Fourth of July brought out the first visitors to the Statue of Liberty since Hurricane Sandy shut down the most famous monument in New York Harbor.

headline.main: After 8 Months Away, Crowds Swarm to See a Storm Survivor
headline.print_headline: After 8 Months Away, Crowds Swarm to See a Storm Survivor
